content: No, rust itself does not cause tetanus infection. Tetanus is caused by a bacteria called Clostridium tetani, which can be found in soil, dust, and manure. Rust may harbor the bacteria, but it is not the direct cause of tetanus. It's important to clean any wounds thoroughly and consider getting a tetanus shot if you haven't had one in the past 5-10 years, especially if the wound is deep or dirty.
